column4: does anyone know how to clear space in kubuntu? i have 5gs dedicated to it, but yet im out o fspace even though all i have on here is the OS... everything else is on my windows partition
i did that and also autoremove
have you installed lots of packages ?
only beryl and related stuff nothing else
hmm, did you create a swap file or something ?
ok so what od i do?
maybe use the gnome disk usage util or something
or you can do a du -sk / | sort -n
disk usage, summary (in kilobytes) per directory in the directory you give it (ie /)
you can then find the biggest, and then work through each until you find out what is eating your space
it takes a while to run though as it trawls the directory structure to do it
thanks ill let u know the output
du: `/proc/5251/task': No such file or directory
